meanings.definition: Unable to keep still or silent, especially because of impatience, dissatisfaction, or boredom.
meanings.sent1: The restive child squirmed in his seat during the long lecture.
meanings.sent2: The restless puppy kept pacing back and forth in the room.
meanings.sent3: The restive squirrel chattered loudly, demanding more nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a restive horse, constantly galloping from one thought to another.
meanings.sent5: The restive waves crashed against the shore, eager to break free.

meanings.sent1: The restive horse refused to be bridled by the stable hand.
meanings.sent2: The wild stallion was too restive to be tamed by any trainer.
meanings.sent3: The restive cat knocked over the vase, asserting its independence.
meanings.sent4: His spirit was as restive as a rebellious storm, refusing to be contained.
meanings.sent5: The restive wind howled through the night, defying all attempts to calm it down.
